snippet: The raid by militants on the sacred Al Askari Mosque in Samarra, rebuilt after attacks in 2006 that set off a wave of sectarian violence, left six people dead.
abstract: Sunni extremists fire mortars into Askariya Shrine in Samarra, Iraq, monument sacred to Shiites, killing six people and damaging shrine.

byline.contributor: An Iraqi employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Samarra, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The raid by militants on the sacred Al Askari Mosque in Samarra, rebuilt after attacks in 2006 that set off a wave of sectarian violence, left six people dead.

headline.main: Extremists in Iraq Attack Shiite Shrine, Killing 6
headline.print_headline: Extremists in Iraq Attack Shiite Shrine, Killing 6

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
